ratings.comment: I was not able to pay attention at all during this class. Beyond boring. I think I spaced out in just about every single lecture. The professor doesn't even understand the words he is saying sometimes. He would throw a bunch of words into a sentence that make absolutely no sense.

The best professor I've had at UW-Madison. Anything that is on the exam or papers will be covered in lecture. He makes sure that you're actually learning the material rather than memorizing. Basically if you go to class and skim the readings, you'll get a good grade

Adam is a laid back lecturer. Theres a lot of reading but the lecture discusses the readings thoroughly . Grading was really fair. 2 written exams, a paper and 1 group project. No reason you shouldn't get at least a B.
Absolutely incredible! Cares way more than almost every other teacher I have. Builds an awesome inclass environment and is super easy to get along with.

Adam is legit the most amazing teacher! If you have an opportunity to take a class with him DO IT! literally any class, just take it with him! He's super cool and explains everything really well.  I took a comm B section with him this semester and the entire class was sad to see it end.  Moral of the story, TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM!

Adam cares about his students a lot.  He even has extra office hours on the terrace because he wants to meet everyone, and he learns everyone's names in the first week.  He is also very easy to talk to personally.  The class is not too much work, except the grading for papers is very strict.  My favorite class I've taken here.

Definitely take a class with Adam if you have the chance.  He makes it very easy to do well in his class and grades fairly.  He presents the material in a clear, concise way and does a great job of answering your questions even if you're not quite sure what they are.  This was one of the best classes I've taken and highly recommend it.
Adam is awesome. I'd never taken an ethics course and was pleasantly surprised with the class. Be sure to do the readings and visit Adam before turning in papers and you'll do well!

It's a great class! Adam is good at explaining concepts clearly and making the material sounds interesting.As long as you put effort into writing the 2 papers you can get good grades. He also has informal office hours every Friday afternoon at the terrace, chatting with him about philosophy, economics and life is very pleasing!

Adam is a super sweet guy, he's good at explaining stuff to make it easier to understand, and he cares a lot about everyone liking the class.  He even brings cookies sometimes!  no attendance, but it's pretty easy to get yourself to go.  The readings are sometimes REALLY hard.

Adam is great professor and a great guy overall.  He made a boring topic extremely interesting.  You have a quiz almost every monday but it's very easy to get a good grade on if you at least skim a couple pages.  There are two papers that are fairly easy and reasonably graded.  TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM and no one else.  Best class I've had at UW.
